author: Vikas Pathak
text:
The RSS-linked Bharatiya Shikshan Mandal (BSM) has suggested that industry professionals who have worked for seven years and done some innovation be eligible for a doctorate if they can document their work themselves or get a researcher to do it for them.

“In this case, both the professional and the one who documents the work should be eligible for a doctorate,” said Mukul Kanitkar, a functionary of the BSM, referring to a report submitted recently by it to the government to make suggestions for the new education policy.

The report also has a similar suggestion for farmers. If a farmer innovates in his field, he should be eligible for a doctorate in agriculture if a researcher documents his innovation. In this case too, both should be eligible for a doctorate. The idea is to make research more “useful”, Mr. Kanitkar claims.

The report also suggests that Sanskrit or any other classical language be made compulsory in higher education, which means four years after the first eight years of teaching in its scheme. The classical languages available include Persian and Arabic, apart from Hebrew, Latin and Greek. “The medium of teaching in professional institutions should be either Hindi or the regional language,” the report says.

The organisation is hosting an international conference on research quality in Nagpur from February 11 to 14.

The idea is to

make research more useful, says Bharatiya Shikshan Mandal
title: RSS-linked body for new method to award Ph.Ds
